title: This Bukowski letter helped me write thank you messages

section.chapterTitle: To not have entirely wasted one’s life seems to be a worthy accomplishment, if only for myself.
section.body:
> “Kind words don't cost much. Yet they accomplish much.”\
> ― Blaise Pasca

[Bukowski’s Letter of Gratitude to the Man Who Helped Him Quit His Soul-Sucking Job and Become a Full-Time Writer](https://www.themarginalian.org/2014/08/12/charles-bukowski-john-martin-letter/)

The bullet points I took from this were:

* **Address their woes**
* **Find commonality with your own concerns**
* **Commiserate, show understanding**
* **Thank them for something simple and personal.**
* **Express how they know and understand you**
* **Express how they make you better**
* **If you talk about yourself, keep it short**
* **Add some shared experience from your pasts**
* **Share how you’re better because of them**
* **A humble send off**

Your yearn for a more thoughtful and loving world combined with the desire to communicate and be a resource for humanity is an inspiration.  It's what drives your passion for philosophy and me to write this singular blog post.  We know inspiration is rare, but with your spark, this will be the greatest post of all time.  I will thank you for that spark and not waste anymore of your time. 

Thank you,
P.S. remember that carriage accident we were in?
